subject: Re: [junit] Where the code meets the file
msgSnippet: Notice, everyone, how the test tool suggested a change that makes this class more generally useful. Hmmmm. I suggest keeping parse(File) and implementing it
messageBody:
Notice, everyone, how the test tool suggested a change that makes this
class more generally useful. Hmmmm.

I suggest keeping parse(File) and implementing it this way:

public XMLObject parse(final File sourceFile) {
final Reader reader = new BufferedReader(new
FileInputStream(sourceFile));
return parse(reader);
}

Of course, Alain meant to write "Reader" and not "Writer". :)

*********** REPLY SEPARATOR ***********

On 2002-05-01 at 21:40 Alain Ravet wrote:

>David V. Olivier wrote:
>
>>Specifically, I have code that parses a xml catalog file and builds a

>>catalog object structure. I want to verify that the parsing works
>>correctly. In particular, I want to make sure that it robustly
handles
>>unusual conditions such as ..
>>
>>But to do this test I do need some external resource ..
>>
>
>You can replace File by Writer :
>
>Replace
> public XMLObject parse (File source) ..
>
>by
>
> public XMLObject parse (Writer source) ..
>
>
>and test it with :
> ...
> Writer sampleSource = new StringWriter ("<?xml ...........");
> assertEquals (expected, parse (sampleSource) );
> ;..
>
>Alain Ravet
